skills: List each skill as a short phrase, like you'd expect on a resume, one data point per line.
Include soft and hard skills, abilities, and tools you are proficient in.
The AI will choose the most relevant skills for the job you're applying to.
More is better - don't worry about trimming; GPT will filter for fit.
Examples of hard skills: Contract Drafting, SQL, Shopify, Regulatory Compliance, JavaScript
Examples of soft skills: Conflict Resolution, Stakeholder Communication, Time Management
You can include tool-specific knowledge (e.g., Salesforce, Tableau, Asana).
You may group skills by theme (e.g., Legal / Technical / Project Mgmt) if desired.
Avoid vague filler (e.g., Hard Worker, Team Player) - be specific about what you do well.
If in doubt, include it. GPT will ignore what isn't relevant.
Seriously, just include everything you can think of.
You're paying for the tokens, might as well provide as much data as possible.
This is why we're using an AI after all, right?

bullets: Describe what you did in this role.
Use active verbs and measurable outcomes.
One line per notable data point.
Example: Negotiated vendor contracts reducing costs by 15%.
Example: Led cross-functional project team to deploy system upgrade.
Avoid repeating the same data points in multiple roles.
PROVIDE AS MUCH DATA AS POSSIBLE, THE WRITER AI WILL SELECT THE MOST RELEVANT DATA.
The writer will use and select from the provided data to create a resume that is tailored to the job you are applying for.
Honestly, it just works better if you provide a lot of data. The AI will match your data to the job description and create a better resume.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science / Bachelor of Arts / etc.
honors: Any notable accomplishments or academic recognition

special_instructions: Never fabricate data or experience not present in user file.
Do not include demographic or pronoun info unless requested by employer.
Omit irrelevant jobs or degrees unless directly applicable.
